page.title: 06KEMPSEY'S POLICE STATION.
page.content: Kempsey is a large village of 3000 people. Although there is little crime a police officer is still needed.The P.C. Brooks is the only regional constable and has a lot of work on 'petty' crimes. The police station in Kempsey is in fact one room attached to a house and has only been there for 40 years. There is nowhere to deal with very serious offenders who are taken to Worcester where they are detained before they come before the courts. Involvement with Worcester Division is rare and prevented whenever possible. The constable has a 16 hour working day which consists of paper-work, calls and regular visits to the local primary school. He sees his job of being one of community policing rather than simply appearing to do a job in an emergency.
